problems.problem: Define alkenes and give their general formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Alkenes are unsaturated hydrocarbons containing at least one carbon-carbon double bond with the general formula CnH2n.

problems.final_answer: Alkenes: unsaturated hydrocarbons with double bond, CnH2n.

problems.problem: Define alkynes and give their general formula.

step_by_step.explanation: Alkynes are unsaturated hydrocarbons containing at least one carbon-carbon triple bond with the general formula CnH2n-2.

problems.final_answer: Alkynes: unsaturated hydrocarbons with triple bond, CnH2n-2.

problems.problem: Give the IUPAC name of CH2=CH-CH3.

step_by_step.step: Identify parent chain and double bond
step_by_step.explanation: Three-carbon chain with double bond at first carbon → propene

problems.problem: Give the IUPAC name of HC≡C-CH3.

step_by_step.step: Identify parent chain and triple bond
step_by_step.explanation: Three-carbon chain with triple bond at first carbon → propyne

problems.problem: Explain the difference between cis and trans isomers in alkenes.

step_by_step.explanation: Substituents on the same side of the double bond.
Substituents on opposite sides of the double bond.

problems.final_answer: Cis: same side; Trans: opposite sides of double bond.

problems.problem: Write the general equation for the hydrogenation of alkenes.

step_by_step.explanation: Addition of H2 across the double bond in presence of a catalyst (Pt, Pd, Ni).

problems.final_answer: Alkene + H2 → Alkane (in presence of catalyst)

problems.problem: Explain the addition of halogens to alkenes.

step_by_step.explanation: Halogens (Cl2, Br2) add across the double bond to form dihalides via electrophilic addition.

problems.problem: Predict the product of hydration of ethene.

step_by_step.explanation: Ethene reacts with H2O in presence of acid to form ethanol (Markovnikov addition).
In addition of HX to an unsymmetrical alkene, H attaches to the carbon with more H atoms, and X attaches to the carbon with fewer H atoms.

problems.final_answer: Markovnikov: H adds to carbon with more H, X to carbon with fewer H.

problems.problem: Explain the difference in reactivity between alkanes, alkenes, and alkynes.

step_by_step.explanation: Saturated, less reactive; undergo substitution reactions.
More unsaturated than alkenes; undergo addition reactions, sometimes more reactive than alkenes.

problems.final_answer: Alkanes: substitution; Alkenes & Alkynes: addition, more reactive.
